card.name: The One Ring
card.property: Response: If bearer is about to take a wound, he wears The One Ring until the regroup phase. While wearing The One Ring, each time the Ring-bearer is about to take a wound, add 2 burdens instead.
”…the Ring slipped from his fingers as he swam….”

card.name: The One Ring
card.property: Response: If bearer is about to take a wound in a skirmish, he wears The One Ring until the regroup phase. While wearing The One Ring, each time the Ring-bearer is about to take a wound during a skirmish, add a burden instead.
”…the Ring slipped from his fingers as he swam….”

card.name: The One Ring
card.property: Response: If bearer is about to take a wound in a skirmish, he wears The One Ring until the regroup phase. While wearing The One Ring, each time the Ring-bearer is about to take a wound during a skirmish, add a burden instead.
“One Ring to rule them all….”

card.name: Axe Strike
card.property: Skirmish: Make a Dwarf strength +2 (or +3 if bearing a [Dwarven] hand weapon).
Though Gimli's words were praised by the Lady of Light, he proved his best skill was swinging his axe.

card.name: Battle Fury
card.property: Skirmish: Exert a Dwarf to make that Dwarf strength +3 and damage +1.
The Dwarves quickly dispatch Orcs and Uruk-hai with their mighty battle axes.

card.name: Cleaving Blow
card.property: Skirmish: Make a Dwarf strength +2 and damage +1.
The shoddy workmanship of Orc-smiths cannot withstand the fury of Durin's folk.

card.name: Delving
card.property: Fellowship: Exert a Dwarf companion to draw 3 cards.
”'…they delved too greedily and too deep, and disturbed that from which they fled, Durin's Bane.'”

card.name: Dwarf Guard
card.property: To play, spot a Dwarf.
Dwarves from Dain's people are stout companions, trustworthy and loyal.

card.name: Dwarven Armor
card.property: Bearer must be a Dwarf. Bearer may not be overwhelmed unless his strength is tripled.
The strongest armour still being made in Middle-earth is forged by Dwarves. It is so heavy that only they can bear it.

card.name: Dwarven Axe
card.property: Bearer must be a Dwarf. Each time a player's minion loses a skirmish to bearer, that player discards the top card from his draw deck.
”'Buckler and corslet, axe and sword / And shining spears were laid in hoard.'”

card.name: Dwarven Heart
card.property: Bearer must be a Dwarf. When you play this condition, heal bearer up to 2 times. At the start of each of your turns, exert bearer.
”'…a Dwarf goes on, be the burden twice his own weight….'”

card.name: Farin
card.property: To play, spot a Dwarf. While skirmishing an Orc, Farin is strength +2.
Among the envoys sent to represent the Dwarves of Erebor at the Council of Elrond was Farin, a young but wise Dwarf, and a fierce foe in battle.

card.name: Gimli
card.property: Damage +1. Fellowship: If the twilight pool has fewer than 2 twilight tokens, add (2) to place a card from hand beneath your draw deck.
“Gimli now walked ahead by the wizard's side, so eager was he to come to Moria.”

card.name: Gimli
card.property: Damage +1. Skirmish: Exert Gimli to make him strength +2.

card.name: Gimli
card.property: Damage +1. Skirmish: Exert Gimli to make him strength +2.

card.name: Gimli
card.property: Bearer must be Gimli. He is damage +1. Each time Gimli wins a skirmish, you may wound an Orc.
“Beside them Gimli stood with his stout legs apart, wielding his dwarf-axe.”

card.name: Gimli
card.property: Bearer must be Gimli. He is damage +1. Each time Gimli wins a skirmish, you may wound an Orc.
“Beside them Gimli stood with his stout legs apart, wielding his dwarf-axe.”

card.name: Gimli
card.property: Bearer must be Gimli. He takes no more than 1 wound during each skirmish phase. Skirmish: Discard Gimli's Helm to prevent all wounds to him.
A helm fashioned under the Lonely Mountain protects the head of Gimli the Dwarf.

card.name: Greatest Kingdom of My People
card.property: Tale. Exert a Dwarf to play this condition. Plays to your support area. Each time your opponent plays an Orc, that player discards the top card of his or her draw deck.
”'With golden roof and silver floor / And runes of power upon the door.'”

card.name: Grimir
card.property: Fellowship: Exert Grimir to shuffle a [Dwarven] event from your discard pile into your draw deck.
Old and grey after many years spent in exile before the Lonely Mountain was reclaimed, Grimir can still wield his axe with strength.

card.name: Halls of My Home
card.property: Fellowship: Exert a Dwarf to reveal the top 3 cards of any draw deck. You may discard 1 Shadow card revealed. Return the rest in any order.
”'I will go and look on the halls of Durin, whatever may wait there….'”

card.name: Here Lies Balin
card.property: Maneuver: Exert a Dwarf to wound 2 Orcs or to wound 1 Orc twice.
”'I have looked on Moria, and it is very great, but it has become dark and dreadful; and we have found no sign of my kindred.'”

card.name: Let Them Come
card.property: Plays to your support area. Each time a Dwarf wins a skirmish against an Orc, discard that Orc. Discard this condition if a Dwarf loses a skirmish.
”'There is one Dwarf yet in Moria who still draws breath!'”

card.name: Lord of Moria
card.property: Plays to your support area. Each Dwarf is damage +1.
Gimli rushed ahead into the vast, empty chamber to see a huge slab of white stone. Knowing instinctively the significance of this tomb, he fell to his knees, overcome with grief.

card.name: Mithril Shaft
card.property: Maneuver: Exert a Dwarf to discard cards from the top of your draw deck until you choose to stop (limit 5). Add (1) for each card discarded in this way. Take the last card discarded into hand.
”'Mithril! All folk desired it.'”

card.name: Nobody Tosses a Dwarf
card.property: Response: If a Dwarf wins a skirmish, make an opponent discard 3 cards from the top of his or her draw deck.
”'My folk have never had dealings with any of the servants of the Enemy.'”

card.name: Stairs of Khazad-dum
card.property: Tale. Plays to your support area. While a Dwarf skirmishes a [Moria] minion, that Dwarf is strength +1.

card.name: Still Draws Breath
card.property: Response: If a Dwarf wins a skirmish, heal that Dwarf.
“When thirteen had fallen the rest fled shrieking, leaving the defenders unharmed….”

card.name: Their Halls of Stone
card.property: Skirmish: Make a Dwarf strength +2 (or +4 if at an underground site).
”'These are not holes,' said Gimli. 'This is the great realm and city of the Dwarrowdelf. And of old it was not darksome, but full of light and splendour, as is still remembered in our songs.'”

card.name: Thrarin
card.property: Maneuver: Exert Thrarin to allow him to participate in archery fire and skirmishes until the regroup phase.
A blacksmith by trade, Thrarin puts down his hammer and takes up his axe to fight when the need arises.

card.name: Wealth of Moria
card.property: Fellowship: Spot a Dwarf to reveal the top 3 cards of your draw deck. Take all Free Peoples cards revealed into hand and discard the rest.
”'For here alone in all the world was found Moria-silver, or true-silver as some have called it: mithril is the Elvish name.'”

card.name: Ancient Enmity
card.property: Skirmish: Make an Elf strength +1. If a minion loses this skirmish to that Elf, that minion's owner discards 2 cards at random from hand.
Hard and bitter is the Elven hatred of Orcs, for they have lost many kinsmen to Orc savagery.

card.name: Arwen
card.property: Ranger. While skirmishing a Nazgul, Arwen is strength +3.
“Long she had been in the land of her mother's kin, in Lórien beyond the mountains, and was but lately returned to Rivendell to her father's house.”

card.name: Arwen
card.property: Ranger. While skirmishing a Nazgul, Arwen is strength +3.

card.name: Asfaloth
card.property: Bearer must be an Elf. When played on Arwen, Asfaloth's twilight cost is -2. While at a plains site, bearer is strength +2. Discard Asfaloth when at an underground site.
”'Noro lim, Asfaloth, noro lim!'”

card.name: Border Defenses
card.property: Skirmish: Make an Elf strength +2 (or +4 if skirmishing an archer).

card.name: Bow of the Galadhrim
card.property: Bearer must be Legolas. Each time Legolas wins a skirmish, you may wound a minion.
“To Legolas she gave a bow such as the Galadhrim used, longer and stouter than the bows of Mirkwood, and strung with a string of elfhair.”

card.name: Celeborn
card.property: Fellowship: Exert Celeborn to heal an [Elven] ally.

“They were clad wholly in white … and the hair of the Lord Celeborn was of silver long and bright; but no sign of age was upon them, unless it were in the depths of their eyes; for these were keen as lances in the starlight, and yet profo

card.name: The Council of Elrond
card.property: Fellowship: Spot an Elf to play a tale from your draw deck.

”'You will hear today all that you need in order to understand the purposes of the Enemy …. What shall we do with the Ring, the least of rings, the trifle that Sauron fancies? That is the doom that we must deem.'”

card.name: Curse Their Foul Feet
card.property: Fellowship: Exert an Elf to reveal an opponent's hand. That player discards a card from hand for each Orc revealed.
”'A strong company of Orcs has passed. They crossed the Nimrodel - curse their foul feet in its clean water!'”

card.name: Defiance
card.property: Skirmish: Make an Elf strength +2 (or +4 if skirmishing a Nazgul).
”'If you want him, come and claim him!'”

card.name: Double Shot
card.property: Archery: Spot an Elf archer companion to make the fellowship archery total +1.
“The affray was sharp, but the orcs were dismayed by the fierceness of the defence. Legolas shot two through the throat.”

card.name: Elf-song
card.property: Fellowship: Spot an Elf to remove a burden.
”…the beauty of the melodies and of the interwoven words in elven-tongues, even though he understood them little, held him in a spell, as soon as he began to attend to them.”

card.name: Elrond
card.property: To play, spot Gandalf or an Elf. At the start of each of your turns, heal every ally whose home is site 3. Fellowship: Exert Elrond to draw a card.
“He was the Lord of Rivendell and mighty among both Elves and Men.”

card.name: Elven Bow
card.property: Bearer must be an Elf. Bearer is an archer.
”'We live now upon an island amid many perils, and our hands are more often upon the bowstring than upon the harp.'”

card.name: Elven Cloak
card.property: To play, spot an Elf. Bearer must be a companion. The minion archery total is -1.
”'…never before have we clad strangers in the garb of our own people.'”

card.name: Far-seeing Eyes
card.property: Plays to your support area. Each time you play an Elf, choose an opponent to discard a card from hand.
Keen Elven eyes see farther and more clearly than those of Men or Dwarves.

card.name: Foul Creation
card.property: Fellowship: Exert an Elf to reveal an opponent's hand. You may discard a [Isengard] minion revealed to draw 2 cards.
Saruman's Uruk-hai mirrored the singular focus of their master, viewing with contempt and disgust all they encountered.

card.name: Galadriel
card.property: At the start of each of your turns, heal every ally whose home is site 6. Fellowship: Exert Galadriel to play an Elf for free.
“Very tall they were, and the Lady no less tall than the Lord; and they were grave and beautiful … and the hair of the Lady was of deep gold….”

card.name: Gift of Boats
card.property: To play, exert an Elf ally. Plays to your support area. When the fellowship moves from a river during the fellowship phase, the move limit for this turn is +1.
”'They will not sink, lade them as you will; but they are wayward if mishandled.'”

card.name: Gwemegil
card.property: Bearer must be Arwen. She is damage +1. Skirmish: Exert Arwen or discard 2 cards from hand to make her strength +1.
Forged by the Elven-smiths of Rivendell, Arwen's blade bears enchantments to ward off the forces of the Great Eye.

card.name: Haldir
card.property: To play, spot an Elf. While Haldir is at site 6, 7, or 8, he is strength +2.
”'But there are some of us still who go abroad for the gathering of news and the watching of our enemies …. I am one. Haldir is my name.'”

card.name: The Last Alliance of Elves and Men
card.property: Tale. Bearer must be a [Gondor] Man. Limit 1 per bearer. Bearer is strength +1 for each Elf you can spot (limit +3).
“But Sauron of Mordor assailed them, and they made the Last Alliance of Elves and Men, and the hosts of Gil-galad and Elendil were mustered….”

card.name: Legolas
card.property: Archer. Archery: Exert Legolas to wound a minion; Legolas does not add to the fellowship archery total.
”'And I too will go with him,' said Legolas. 'It would be faithless now to say farewell.'”

card.name: Legolas
card.property: Archer. Archery: Exert Legolas to wound a minion; Legolas does not add to the fellowship archery total.
”'And I too will go with him,' said Legolas. 'It would be faithless now to say farewell.'”

card.name: Legolas
card.property: Archer. While skirmishing a Nazgul, Legolas is strength +3.
“There was also a strange Elf clad in green and brown, Legolas, a messenger from his father, Thranduil, the King of the Elves of Northern Mirkwood.”

card.name: Lightfootedness
card.property: Archery: Spot an Elf companion to make the minion archery total -1.
”'…let a ploughman plough, but choose an otter for swimming, and for running light over grass and leaf, or over snow - an Elf.'”

card.name: Lorien Elf
card.property: To play, spot an Elf.
”'…we dwell now in the heart of the forest, and do not willingly have dealings with any other folk.'”

card.name: Mallorn-trees
card.property: Plays to your support area. Fellowship: Reveal an [Elven] card from hand and place it beneath your draw deck.
“Upon the further side there rose to a great height a green wall encircling a green hill thronged with mallorn-trees taller than any they had yet seen in all the land.”

card.name: The Mirror of Galadriel
card.property: Plays to your support area. Each Elf ally whose home is site 6 is strength +1. Maneuver: If an opponent has at least 7 cards in hand, exert Galadriel to look at 2 of those cards at random. Discard one and replace the other.
”'What you will see I cannot tell….'”

card.name: Orophin
card.property: Archer. Archery: Exert Orophin to wound an Uruk-hai.
The swift bow of Orophin, Haldir's kinsman, has slain many Orcs.

card.name: Rumil
card.property: Archer. Archery: Exert Rumil to wound an Orc.

card.name: The Seen and the Unseen
card.property: Fellowship: Exert 2 Elves to discard a condition.
”'You have entered the realm of the Lady of the Wood - you cannot go back.'”

card.name: Shoulder to Shoulder
card.property: Plays to your support area. Maneuver: Add (1) and exert a Dwarf to heal an Elf, or add (1) and exert an Elf to heal a Dwarf.
”'May it be a sign that though the world is now dark better days are at hand, and that friendship shall be renewed between our peoples.'”

card.name: Silinde
card.property: While you can spot your site 3, Silinde has the game text of that site.
Among the representatives of the Elves of Northern Mirkwood was Silinde, friend of the House of Thranduil.

card.name: Songs of the Blessed Realm
card.property: Plays to your support area. Each time you play an [Elven] tale, you may remove a burden.
Elves seem to like music and poetry and tales as much as Hobbits like food.

card.name: The Splendor of Their Banners
card.property: Tale. Bearer must be an Elf companion. Archery: If bearer is an archer, exert bearer to make the fellowship archery total +1.
”'It recalled to me the glory of the Elder Days and the hosts of Beleriand, so many great princes and captains were assembled.'”

card.name: Stand Against Darkness
card.property: Maneuver: Exert an Elf to discard a [Sauron] minion, a [Sauron] condition, or a [Sauron] possession.
”'What power still remains lies with us, here in Imladrisstrength, have we here the strength to withstand the Enemy…?'”

card.name: Support of the Last Homely House
card.property: Maneuver: Exert an Elf ally whose home is site 3. Until the regroup phase, that ally is strength +3 and participates in archery fire and skirmishes.
“Merely to be there was a cure for weariness, fear, and sadness.”

card.name: Swan-ship of the Galadhrim
card.property: Maneuver: Exert an Elf ally whose home is site 6. Until the regroup phase, that ally is strength +3 and participates in archery fire and skirmishes.
”…and suddenly they perceived that it was a ship, wrought and carved with elven-skill in the likeness of a bird.”

card.name: The Tale of Gil-galad
card.property: Tale. Bearer must be an Elf. Skirmish: Discard this condition to make bearer strength +2.
“Gil-galad was an Elven-king / Of him the harpers sadly sing: / the last whose realm was fair and free / between the Mountains and the Sea.”

card.name: Uruviel
card.property: While you can spot your site 6, Uruviel has the game text of that site.
An Elf-maid of the Galadhrim, Uruviel has dwelt for years beneath the mallorn-trees

card.name: The White Arrows of Lorien
card.property: Tale. Bearer must be an Elf companion. Archery: If bearer is an archer, exert bearer to make an opponent discard 2 cards at random from hand.
Straight and true, the arrows of the Golden Wood are known to leave a deadly mark.

card.name: Albert Dreary
card.property: To play, spot Gandalf. Maneuver: Exert Albert Dreary to discard a [Isengard] or [Moria] condition.
Typical of Bree-folk, Albert is a plain but stout-hearted fellow. He does not seek trouble, but he is willing to protect his home.

card.name: Barliman Butterbur
card.property: Fellowship: Exert Barliman Butterbur to take a [Gandalf] event into hand from your discard pile.
”'You don't know much even about them, if you think old Barliman is stupid,' said Gandalf. 'He is wise enough on his own ground.'”

card.name: Durin
card.property: Fellowship: Spot Gandalf, a Dwarf, and an Elf to make the move limit for this turn +1.
”'They are wrought of ithildin that mirrors only starlight and moonlight, and sleeps until it is touched by one who speaks words now long forgotten in Middle-earth.'”

card.name: Gandalf
card.property: Gandalf is strength +1 for each of these races you can spot in the fellowship: Hobbit, Dwarf, Elf, and Man.
”'Among the Wise I am the only one that goes in for hobbit-lore: an obscure branch of knowledge, but full of surprises.'”

card.name: Gandalf
card.property: Gandalf is strength +1 for each of these races you can spot in the fellowship: Hobbit, Dwarf, Elf, and Man.
”'Among the Wise I am the only one that goes in for hobbit-lore: an obscure branch of knowledge, but full of surprises.'”

card.name: Gandalf
card.property: Plays to your support area. Fellowship: Stack a Free Peoples artifact (or possession) from hand on this card, or play a card stacked here as if played from hand.
”…a cart came in through Bywater … An old man was driving it all alone.”

card.name: Gandalf
card.property: Bearer must be Gandalf. Fellowship: Discard a pipeweed possession and spot X pipes to remove X burdens.
”'I know what is the matter with me,' he muttered, as he sat down by the door. 'I need smoke!'”

card.name: Glamdring
card.property: Bearer must be Gandalf. He is damage +1. Fellowship or Regroup: Exert Gandalf to reveal an opponent's hand. Remove (1) for each Orc revealed.
”…in his other hand Glamdring gleamed, cold and white.”

card.name: Intimidate
card.property: Spell. Response: If a companion is about to take a wound, spot Gandalf to prevent that wound.
”'Go back to the Shadow!'”

card.name: Let Folly Be Our Cloak
card.property: Fellowship: Exert X companions to remove (X).
”'Well, let folly be our cloak, a veil before the eyes of the Enemy! … Into his heart the thought will not enter that any will refuse it, that having the Ring we may seek to destroy it.'”

card.name: Mysterious Wizard
card.property: Spell. Skirmish: Make Gandalf strength +2 (or +4 if there are 4 or fewer burdens on the Ring-bearer).
”'…there are older and fouler things than Orcs in the deep places of the world.'”

card.name: The Nine Walkers
card.property: To play, spot Gandalf. Plays to your support area. Each time you play a companion whose race you cannot spot, that companion's twilight cost is -2.
”'Nine companions to match the Nine Ringwraiths … So be it.'”

card.name: Ottar
card.property: To play, spot Gandalf. Fellowship: Exert Ottar to discard up to 3 cards from hand and draw an equal number of cards.
The Men of Laketown come from the North, where they trade with the Dwarves of the Lonely Mountain.

card.name: Questions That Need Answering
card.property: Spell. Fellowship: If the twilight pool has fewer than 3 twilight tokens, spot Gandalf to look at the top 4 cards of your draw deck. Take 2 of those cards into hand and discard the rest.
”'There are some things that I must see to….'”

card.name: Risk a Little Light
card.property: Spell. Fellowship: If the twilight pool has fewer than 2 twilight tokens, spot Gandalf to look at the top 2 cards of your draw deck. Take one into hand and discard the other.
”'Let me risk a little more light.'”

card.name: Servant of the Secret Fire
card.property: Spell. Skirmish: Spot Gandalf to make a minion strength -3.
”'I am a servant of the Secret Fire, wielder of the flame of Anor. You cannot pass.'”

card.name: Servant of the Secret Fire
card.property: Spell. Skirmish: Spot gandalf to make a minion strength -3.
”'I am a servant of the Secret Fire, wielder of the flame of Anor. You cannot pass.'”

card.name: Sleep
card.property: Spell. Fellowship: Exert Gandalf to discard every condition.
”'Losto Caradhras, sedho, hodo, nuitho i ruith.'”

card.name: Strength of Spirit
card.property: Spell. Response: If a companion is about to exert, spot Gandalf to place no token for that exertion.
”'There are many powers in the world, for good or for evil. Some are greater than I am. Against some I have not yet been measured. But my time is coming.'”

card.name: Treachery Deeper Than You Know
card.property: Spell. Fellowship: Spot Gandalf to reveal an opponent's hand.
”'By foul craft, Saruman has crossed Orc with Goblin Men - he is breeding an army in the Caverns of Isengard.'”

card.name: A Wizard Is Never Late
card.property: Fellowship: Play a [Gandalf] character from your draw deck.
”'A wizard is never late, Frodo Baggins, nor is he early. He arrives precisely when he means to.'”

card.name: An Able Guide
card.property: Regroup: Spot a ranger to remove (4).
”'…though I cannot disappear, I have hunted many wild and wary things and I can usually avoid being seen, if I wish.'”

card.name: Aragorn
card.property: Ranger. Maneuver: Exert Aragorn to make him defender +1 until the regroup phase.
”'Lonely men are we, Rangers of the wild, The hunters - but The hunters ever of the servants of the Enemy….'”

card.name: Aragorn
card.property: Ranger. Exert Aragorn to make him Defender +1 until the regroup phase.
”'Lonely men are we, Rangers of the wild, The hunters - but The hunters ever of the servants of the Enemy….'”

card.name: Aragorn
card.property: Bearer must be Aragorn. He is an archer. Archery: Exert Aragorn to wound a minion; Aragorn does not add to the fellowship archery total.
Rangers learn the bow as well as the blade.

card.name: Aragorn
card.property: Bearer must be a [Gondor] companion. Fellowship: Discard a pipeweed possession and spot X pipes to heal X companions.
“He had a tall tankard in front of him, and was smoking a long-stemmed pipe curiously carved.”

card.name: Armor
card.property: Bearer must be a Man. Bearer takes no more than 1 wound during each skirmish phase.
“Then Elendil the Tall….”

card.name: Arwen
card.property: Skirmish: Exert Aragorn to make Arwen strength +3, or exert Arwen to make Aragorn strength +3.
For the love of a mortal Man, Arwen, daughter of Elrond, must forsake her Elven heritage, and give up forever her journey to the Undying Lands.

card.name: Athelas
card.property: Bearer must be a [Gondor] Man. Fellowship: Discard this possession to heal a companion or to remove a Shadow condition from a companion.
The hands of the king are the hands of a healer, and so shall the true king be known.

card.name: Blade of Gondor
card.property: Bearer must be Boromir. He is damage +1. Skirmish: Exert Boromir to wound an Orc or Uruk-hai he is skirmishing.
With the valour of Boromir's mighty longsword, the Enemies of the West are kept at bay.

card.name: Boromir
card.property: Ranger. Boromir is not overwhelmed unless his strength is tripled.
”'…Boromir will also be in the Company. He is a valiant man.'”

card.name: Boromir
card.property: Ranger. Boromir is not overwhelmed unless his strength is tripled.
”'…Boromir will also be in the Company. He is a valiant man.'”

card.name: Boromir
card.property: Skirmish: Exert Boromir to make a Hobbit strength +3.
”'Long has my father, the Steward of Gondor, held the forces of Mordor at bay - by the blood of our people are the lands of others kept safe.'”

card.name: Boromir
card.property: Bearer must be Boromir. Maneuver: Exert Boromir to discard a weather condition.
“He was cloaked and booted as if for a journey on horseback; and indeed though his garments were rich, and his cloak was lined with fur, they were stained with long travel.”

card.name: Change of Plans
card.property: Regroup: Exert a ranger to make an opponent shuffle his hand into his draw deck and draw 8 cards.
”'Then let me help you. There are other ways, Frodo - other paths that we might take.'”

card.name: The Choice of Luthien
card.property: Tale. Plays to your support area. Maneuver: Exert Aragorn to heal Arwen, or exert Arwen to heal Aragorn.
”'But she chose mortality, and to die from the world, so that she might follow him; and it is sung that they met again beyond the Sundering Seas….'”

card.name: Coat of Mail
card.property: Bearer must be a Man. Bearer may not be overwhelmed unless his or her strength is tripled.
Soldiers of the White Tower have long appreciated the craftsmanship of the Gondorian metalsmiths.

card.name: Dagger Strike
card.property: Skirmish: Make a [Gondor] or [Shire] companion bearing a hand weapon strength +2 and damage +1.
Every warrior needs a sword, bow, or axe - but sometimes, a dagger is enough.

card.name: Elendil
card.property: Maneuver: Make a [Gondor] companion defender +1 until the regroup phase.
”shield was scored with runes / to ward all wounds and harm from him….'”

card.name: Eregion
card.property: Maneuver: Exert a ranger to make each roaming minion strength -3 until the regroup phase.
“Guided by Aragorn they struck a good path. It looked to Frodo like the remains of an ancient road, that had once been broad and well planned….”

card.name: Foes of Mordor
card.property: Plays to your support area. Maneuver: Exert a [Gondor] character to wound a [Sauron] minion.
Through the long years, the Men of the Tower of Guard have shielded the West from the minions of the Eye.

card.name: Gondor
card.property: Regroup: Exert a ranger companion to discard a minion.
A Ranger in the wild is a deadly foe for the forces of the Shadow.

card.name: Great Shield
card.property: Bearer must be a Man. The minion archery total is -1.
The Kingdom of Gondor has smiths much practiced in creating strong tools of war.

card.name: No Stranger to the Shadows
card.property: Bearer must be a ranger. Limit 1 per ranger. Each site's shadow number is -1.
”'Ah, but you had not got me with you then,' laughed Strider. 'My cuts, short or long, don't go wrong.'”

card.name: One Whom Men Would Follow
card.property: Maneuver: Exert Aragorn to spot an ally. Until the regroup phase, that ally is strength +2 and participates in archery fire and skirmishes.
”'The skill of the elves can reforge the Sword of Elendil - but only you have the power to wield it.'”

card.name: Pathfinder
card.property: Fellowship or Regroup: Spot a ranger to play the fellowship's next site (replacing opponent's site if necessary).
”'Strider can take you by paths that are seldom trodden. Will you have him?'”

card.name: Pursuit Just Behind
card.property: Regroup: Exert a ranger companion to wound every minion.
”'We must do something to delay the enemy first. We will make them fear the Chamber of Mazarbul!'”

card.name: Ranger
card.property: Bearer must be Aragorn. He is damage +1.
Aragorn is a trustworthy companion and a deadly foe. His years roaming the wild have honed his swordfighting skills.

card.name: A Ranger
card.property: Maneuver: Exert a ranger at a river or forest to exhaust a minion.
”'If you bring a Ranger with you, it is well to pay attention to him, especially if the Ranger is Aragorn.'”

card.name: The Saga of Elendil
card.property: Tale. Bearer must be a [Gondor] companion. Skirmish: Discard this condition to make bearer strength +2.

card.name: The Saga of Elendil
card.property: Tale. Bearer must be a [Gondor] companion. Skirmish: discard this condition to make bearer strength +2.

card.name: Strength of Kings
card.property: Response: If a Skirmish event is played during a skirmish involving a [Gondor] Man, cancel that event.

card.name: Swordarm of the White Tower
card.property: Skirmish: Make a [Gondor] companion strength +2 (or +4 if he is defender +1).
”'By our valour the wild folk of the East are still restrained, and the terror of Morgul kept at bay; and thus alone are peace and freedom maintained in the lands behind us, bulwark of the West.'”

card.name: Swordsman of the Northern Kingdom
card.property: Skirmish: Make a ranger strength +2 (or +4 when skirmishing a roaming minion).
”'This is no mere Ranger. He is Aragorn, son of Arathorn … and you owe him your allegiance.'”

card.name: Valiant Man of the West
card.property: Maneuver: Make Aragorn defender +1 and he takes no more than 1 wound during each skirmish phase until the regroup phase.
”'…I swore to protect you.'”

card.name: What Are They
card.property: Maneuver: Spot a ranger to discard a roaming minion.
”'They were men … once.'”

card.name: Alive and Unspoiled
card.property: To play, exert an Uruk-hai. Plays to your support area. Shadow: Remove (3) and spot X burdens to make the Free Peoples player reveal X cards at random from hand. You may discard 1 revealed card.
”'Bring them to me…. Kill the others….'”

card.name: Bred for Battle
card.property: Skirmish: Exert an Uruk-hai to make it strength +3.

”'You are the Uruk-hai of Isengard! The blood in your veins is black and cold - you do not know pain, you do not know fear - for you are the servants of the White Hand - the hand that gives you Man flesh to eat!'”

card.name: Breeding Pit
card.property: Response: If you play an Uruk-hai, take all copies of that card in your discard pile and place them beneath your draw deck.
”'He is breeding an army in the Caverns of Isengard. An army that can move in sunlight and cover great distance at speed.'”

card.name: Caradhras Has Not Forgiven Us
card.property: Spell. Weather. Maneuver: Exert a [Isengard] minion and spot 5 companions to discard an exhausted companion (except the Ring-bearer).
”'It was no ordinary storm. It is the ill will of Caradhras.'”

card.name: Cruel Caradhras
card.property: Spell. Weather. Maneuver: Exert a [Isengard] minion to make the opponent choose to either exert the Ring-bearer or add a burden.
”'Yonder stands Barazinbar, the Redhorn, cruel Caradhras….'”

card.name: Greed
card.property: To play, spot an Uruk-hai. Plays to your support area. Maneuver: Spot 6 companions and remove (2) to wound a companion (except the Ring-bearer).
”'It is a strange fate that we should suffer so much fear and doubt over so small a thing….'”

card.name: Hunt Them Down
card.property: Maneuver: Make an Uruk-hai fierce until the regroup phase.
”'Do not stop until they are found!”

card.name: Lurtz
card.property: Archer. Damage +1. Maneuver: Spot another Uruk-hai to make Lurtz fierce until the regroup phase.
”'And now… perfected. Grown beyond the height of Men - straight-limbed and strong, fearing nothing.'”

card.name: Lurtz
card.property: Archer. Damage +1. Maneuver: Spot another Uruk-hai to make Lurtz fierce until the regroup phase.
”'And now… perfected. Grown beyond the height of Men - straight-limbed and strong, fearing nothing.'”

card.name: Lurtz
card.property: Skirmish: Make an Uruk-hai strength -1 and damage +1.
”'Find the Halflings!'”

card.name: The Misadventure of Mr
card.property: To play, exert an Uruk-hai. Plays to your support area. The twilight cost of each companion played to a site which is not a sanctuary is +2.
”'You're drawing far too much attention to yourself… Mr. Underhill.'”

card.name: No Ordinary Storm
card.property: Plays to your support area. Each time you play a weather condition, exert a [Gandalf] companion or [Gandalf] ally.
”'So Gandalf… you try to lead them over Caradhras. And if that fails - where then will you go?'”

card.name: Orthanc Assassin
card.property: Archer. Damage +1.
Black-feathered arrows from Uruk-hai bows reign over the corpses of Saruman's enemies.

card.name: Parry
card.property: Maneuver: Spot an Uruk-hai to cancel the strength bonus from a possession until the regroup phase.
Even the sword of a powerful warrior can be parried by the strength of an Uruk-hai.

card.name: Saruman
card.property: Plays to your support area. The twilight cost of your [Isengard] events is -1. Skirmish: Discard this condition to make an Uruk-hai strength +2.
”'I did not expect you to show wisdom, even in your own behalf; but I gave you the chance of aiding me willingly, and so saving yourself much trouble and pain.'”

card.name: Saruman
card.property: Spell. Weather. To play, exert a [Isengard] minion. Plays on a site. Limit 1 per site. Each Hobbit who moves from this site must exert. Discard this condition at the end of the turn.
Saruman's hand can control the chill of winter.

card.name: Saruman
card.property: Spell. Weather. To play, exert a [Isengard] minion. Plays on a site. Limit 1 per site. Each Hobbit at this site is strength -2. Discard this condition at the end of the turn.
The small and weak suffer first from the The White Wizard's powerful sorcery.

card.name: Saruman
card.property: Spell. Shadow: Exert a [Isengard] minion to discard all conditions.
The Uruks of Saruman are bred to be the instruments of his will, destroying his enemies with foul cruelty.

card.name: Saruman
card.property: Search. Maneuver: Exert an Uruk-hai to make the opponent choose to either exert 2 companions or make the Ring-bearer put on The One Ring until the regroup phase.
Saruman used both magic and minions to impose his will.

card.name: Saruman
card.property: Spell. Weather. To play, exert a [Isengard] minion. Plays on a site. No player may play skirmish events or use skirmish special abilities during skirmishes at this site. Discard this condition at the end of the turn.
Saruman's spells can hinder even the wary.

card.name: Savagery to Match Their Numbers
card.property: Skirmish: Make an Uruk-hai strength +2, or spot 5 companions to make an Uruk-hai strength +4 and fierce until the regroup phase.
Uruk-hai match their enemies' strength with their own feral rage.

card.name: Spies of Saruman
card.property: To play, exert a [Isengard] minion. Plays on a site. While the fellowship is at this site, skip the archery phase. Discard this condition at the end of the turn.
”'…they are crebain out of Fangorn or Dunland. I do not know what they are about….'”

card.name: Their Arrows Enrage
card.property: To play, spot Saruman or an Uruk-hai. Plays to your support area. Each archer companion and archer ally is strength -1.
The ferocious charge of the Uruk-hai catches enemy archers groping for their swords.

card.name: Traitor
card.property: Search. To play, spot an Uruk-hai. Plays to your support area. While the Ring-bearer is exhausted or you can spot 5 burdens, the move limit for this turn is -1 (to a minimum of 1).
”'In all the long wars with the Dark Tower treason has ever been our greatest foe.'”

card.name: Troop of Uruk-hai
card.property: Damage +1. A character skirmishing this minion does not gain strength bonuses from weapons.
Attacking in swarming hordes, the Urukhai close with the enemy rapidly to make weapons useless.

card.name: Uruk Bloodlust
card.property: Plays to your support area. Response: If your Uruk-hai wins a skirmish, remove (1) to heal him.
”'Take them alive!'”

card.name: Uruk Brood
card.property: Damage +1. Skirmish: Remove (2) to make this minion strength +1 for each other Uruk-hai you spot.
”'He does not see the caverns hidden deep beneath this tower… nor does he know what is growing there.'”

card.name: Uruk Fighter
card.property: Damage +1. Maneuver: Spot 5 companions to make this minion fierce until the regroup phase.
Not stealth or cunning, but strength and ferocity are the weapons of Saruman's army of abominations.

card.name: Uruk Guard
card.property: Damage +1. Assignment: Exert this minion and spot a companion to prevent the opponent from assigning that companion to this minion.
”'SWolves and orcs were housed in Isengard, for Saruman was mustering a great force….'”

card.name: Uruk Lieutenant
card.property: Damage +1. This minion is strength +1 for each other Uruk-hai you can spot.
Uruk-hai leaders gain savagery from their following hordes to maintain the rule of the strong.

card.name: Uruk Messenger
card.property: Damage +1. While you can spot a weather condition, this minion is strength +3.
Saruman uses his Uruks abroad to gain information on the movements - and weaknesses - of his many enemies.

card.name: Uruk Rager
card.property: Damage +1. Each time this minion wins a skirmish, the Free Peoples player must discard the top 2 cards of his draw deck.
A bloodthirsty bellow from a huge Uruk can win a skirmish before it begins.

card.name: Uruk Savage
card.property: Damage +1.
”'The friendship of Saruman is not lightly thrown aside. One ill turn deserves another …. We have work to do.'”

card.name: Uruk Shaman
card.property: Damage +1. Maneuver: Remove (2) to heal an Uruk-hai.
Uruk shamans know the arts of healing as well as those of battle.

card.name: Uruk Slayer
card.property: Damage +1. Skirmish: Remove (1) to make this minion strength +1 (limit +3).
A foe who is willing to kill or die outright is a foe to be feared indeed.

card.name: Uruk Soldier
card.property: Damage +1. When you play this minion, you may make the Free Peoples player discard the top card of his draw deck.
Saruman's Uruk-hai band together as an extremely effective fighting unit.

card.name: Uruk Spy
card.property: Response: If the Ring-bearer puts on The One Ring, exert this minion. Discard a card from the top of your draw deck for each [Isengard] minion you spot. Add a burden for each Shadow card discarded in this way.
A wary eye on the mission could undo the quest.

card.name: Uruk Warrior
card.property: Damage +1. Maneuver: Spot 6 companions to make this minion fierce until the regroup phase.
Powerful and fearless, Uruk-hai warriors are not intimidated by the weapons or numbers of their enemies.

card.name: Uruk-hai Armory
card.property: Plays to your support area. While you can spot an Uruk-hai, the fellowship archery total is -1.
The ranks of Saruman's army include forgers of weapons and armour.

card.name: Uruk-hai Raiding Party
card.property: Damage +1.
”'Imagine, Gandalf, an army - born from the earth of Isengard.'”

card.name: Uruk-hai Rampage
card.property: To play, spot an Uruk-hai. Plays to your support area. Response: If your Uruk-hai wins a skirmish, remove (3) to make him fierce until the regroup phase.
Victory breeds rage in Saruman's foul creations.

card.name: Uruk-hai Sword
card.property: Bearer must be an Uruk-hai. Each time bearer wins a skirmish, the Free Peoples player must discard the top card of his draw deck.
Their malevolent strength worsens the wounds from the gruesome weapons of the Uruks.

card.name: Wariness
card.property: Search. Response: If a stealth event is played, exert or discard your Uruk-hai to cancel that event.
Even Hobbits have trouble evading the Uruk-hai.

card.name: Worry
card.property: To play, exert an Uruk-hai. Plays to your support area. Each time a companion or ally loses a skirmish involving an Uruk-hai, the opponent must choose to either exert the Ring-bearer or add a burden.
”'One by one, regardless of their strength to good or evil… they fell.'”

card.name: Ancient Chieftain
card.property: For each other [Moria] Orc you can spot, Ancient Chieftain is strength +1.
”…a huge orc-chieftain, almost man-high, clad in black mail from head to foot, leaped into the chamber; behind him his followers clustered in the doorway.”

card.name: Bitter Hatred
card.property: Archery: Spot a [Moria] archer to wound an Elf.
Bitter and long is the hatred of the Orcs for the Elves, and thus they prefer Elves as targets.

card.name: Cave Troll of Moria
card.property: Damage +1. Fierce. To play, spot a [Moria] Orc. At an underground site, Cave Troll of Moria's twilight cost is -3.
Frodo's quest nearly ended before his companions halted the Cave Troll's ferocious attack.

card.name: Cave Troll of Moria
card.property: Damage +1. Fierce. To play, spot a [Moria] Orc. At an underground site, Cave Troll of Moria's twilight cost is -3.
Frodo's quest nearly ended before his companions halted the Cave Troll's ferocious attack.

card.name: Cave Troll
card.property: Bearer must be Cave Troll of Moria. Cave Troll of Moria is damage +1.
Suddenly the door burst into fragments and the Cave Troll was among them, his huge hammer striking like thunder.

card.name: Denizens Enraged
card.property: Skirmish: Make a [Moria] Orc strength +1 for each other [Moria] Orc you spot (limit +4).
”…there came a great noise: a rolling Boom that seemed to come from depths far below, and to tremble in the stone at their feet.”

card.name: Drums in the Deep
card.property: Skirmish: Make a [Moria] Orc strength +2 (or +4 if skirmishing a Dwarf).
“The drum-beats broke out wildly: doomboom, doom-boom, and then stopped … Doom, doom went the drum-beats again….”

card.name: The End Comes
card.property: Assignment: Spot 5 [Moria] minions to make the Free Peoples player assign the Ring-bearer to a skirmish.
”'They have taken the Bridge and the second hall; we have barred the gates -_but cannot hold them for long….'”

card.name: Fool of a Took
card.property: Shadow: Spot a Hobbit (except the Ring-bearer) to reveal cards from the top of your draw deck until you reveal one that is not a [Moria] minion. Take the revealed cards into hand.
”'Fool of a Took! Throw yourself in next time and rid us of your stupidity!'”

card.name: Frenzy
card.property: Assignment: Assign an exhausted companion (except the Ring-bearer) to skirmish a [Moria] Orc.
The Goblins of the Misty Mountains, like all of their race, use their teeming numbers to slaughter their foes.

card.name: Goblin Archer
card.property: Archer. While you can spot another [Moria] Orc, the fellowship archery total is -6.
“An arrow whistled over Frodo's head.”

card.name: Goblin Armory
card.property: Plays to your support area. Each time you play a [Moria] weapon, add (1). Response: If a [Moria] Orc is about to take a wound, discard this condition to prevent that wound.
For scavenging vermin, the weapons of fallen foes are prized possessions.

card.name: Goblin Backstabber
card.property: This minion is damage +2 while in the same skirmish as another [Moria] Orc.
An attack from behind provides a cowardly Goblin with a boldness much like courage.

card.name: Goblin Domain
card.property: Search. To play, spot a [Moria] minion. Plays to your support area. Each time a companion is played to site 4 or higher, that companion comes into play exhausted.

card.name: Goblin Marksman
card.property: Archer.
“Arrows fell among them. One struck Frodo and sprang back. Another pierced Gandalf's hat and stuck there like a black feather.”

card.name: Goblin Patrol Troop
card.property: “As they ran they heard the beat and echo of many hurrying feet behind. A shrill yell went up: they had been seen. There was a ring and clash of steel.”

card.name: Goblin Runner
card.property: When you play this minion, you may add (2).
”…a great horn was blown in the hall, and answering horns and harsh cries were heard further off. There was a hurrying sound of many feet.”

card.name: Goblin Scavengers
card.property: When you play this minion, you may play a weapon from your discard pile on your [Moria] Orc.
”'The Orcs have often plundered Moria; there is nothing left in the upper halls.'”

card.name: Goblin Scimitar
card.property: Bearer must be a [Moria] Orc. When you play this possession, you may draw a card.
“Some of the swords were crooked: orcscimitars with blackened blades.”

card.name: Goblin Sneak
card.property: When you play this minion, you may place a [Moria] Orc from your discard pile beneath your draw deck.
Their limber forms allow the Goblins of Moria to slither past barred doors and collapsed passageways.

card.name: Goblin Spear
card.property: Bearer must be a [Moria] minion. If bearer kills a companion in a skirmish, add 1 burden (or 2 burdens if that companion was a Hobbit).
Simple creatures with simple weapons can be as deadly as an armoured warrior with a fine sword.

card.name: Goblin Swarms
card.property: Plays to your support area. Response: If your [Moria] Orc wins a skirmish, discard cards and wounds on that Orc and stack that Orc on this condition. Shadow: Play an Orc stacked here as if played from hand.
“Beyond the fire he saw swarming black figures….”

card.name: Goblin Wallcrawler
card.property: While at an underground site, this minion is strength +2. While you can spot another [Moria] Orc, the fellowship archery total is -1.
Skittering along the walls of Moria, Goblins attack without warning.

card.name: Goblin Warrior
card.property: When you play this minion, you may discard a [Dwarven] ally or [Dwarven] condition.
The ancient enmity between Goblins and Dwarves burns brightly still.

card.name: Guard Commander
card.property: Skirmish: Remove (3) to make a [Moria] Orc strength +2.
“His broad flat face was swart, his eyes were like coals, and his tongue was red….”

card.name: Host of Thousands
card.property: Shadow: Play a [Moria] Orc from your discard pile.
Killing one is no victory, since a dozen from the warrens below will take his place.

card.name: The Long Dark
card.property: Plays to your support area. When the fellowship moves to site 4 or 5, add (2) for each Dwarf companion. Skirmish: Discard this condition to make your [Moria] Orc strength +2.
”'So ended the attempt to retake Moria! It was valiant but foolish. The time is not come yet.'”

card.name: Lost to the Goblins
card.property: Response: If the Ring-bearer exerts or takes a wound, discard a card from the top of your draw deck for each [Moria] minion you spot. For each Shadow card discarded in this way, add a burden (limit 3 burdens).
Dwarven graves stood open in plundered disarray.

card.name: Moria Axe
card.property: Bearer must be a [Moria] Orc. Bearer is damage +1. Skirmish: Exert bearer to make him strength +2.
Goblins without scimitars wrest axes from the remains of fallen Dwarves.

card.name: Moria Scout
card.property: When you play this minion, spot an Elf to add (2).
Like their kindred in the North, the Orcs of Moria have keen noses, often following their prey by scent.

card.name: Pinned Down
card.property: Plays to your support area. While you can spot a [Moria] archer, the fellowship archery total is -1.
“Arrows whined and whistled down the corridor as he sprang back.”

card.name: Plundered Armories
card.property: Plays to your support area. Response: If your [Moria] weapon is discarded, play it from your discard pile (that weapon's twilight cost is -1).
The Goblins of Moria have oft plundered the deep armouries of Durin's folk.

card.name: Relentless
card.property: Search. Response: If a stealth event is played, spot 3 [Moria] minions to cancel that event.
”'Then dig a hole in the ground,' said Legolas, 'if that is more after the fashion of your kind. But you must dig swift and deep, if you wish to hide from Orcs.'”

card.name: Relics of Moria
card.property: Plays to your support area. Shadow: Remove (2) to play a [Moria] possession from your discard pile.
“By both the doors they could now see that many bones were lying, and among them were broken swords and axe-heads, and cloven shields and helms.”

card.name: They Are Coming
card.property: Plays to your support area. Shadow: Discard 3 cards from hand to play a [Moria] Orc from your discard pile.
”'The last thing written is in a trailing scrawl of elf-letters: they are coming.'”

card.name: Threat of the Unknown
card.property: Shadow: Exert your [Moria] Orc to draw 2 cards.
The danger of what lay hidden in the dark was more terrifying than the known perils of Moria.

card.name: Through the Misty Mountains
card.property: Search. To play, exert a [Moria] minion. Plays to your support area. Each time the fellowship moves to site 4, 5, or 6 and contains a Dwarf or Elf, the Free Peoples player discards 2 cards at random from hand.
”'One must tread the path that need chooses.'”

card.name: Troll
card.property: Cave Troll of Moria's twilight cost is -2.
Though shorter than a Man, the Troll's Keyward is a deadly adversary.

card.name: The Underdeeps of Moria
card.property: Plays to your support area. Shadow: Remove (3) to reveal the bottom card of your draw deck. If it is a [Moria] Orc, take it into hand. Otherwise, discard it.
”'I am afraid Balin is buried deep, and maybe something else is buried there too.'”

card.name: Unfamiliar Territory
card.property: Skirmish: Make a [Moria] Orc strength +2 (or +4 if skirmishing an archer).
Knowing the dark terrain of Moria gives Orcs a strategic advantage when attacking their foes.

card.name: What Is This New Devilry
card.property: Search. To play, exert a [Moria] Orc. Plays to your support area. While the fellowship is at site 5 or higher, each companion's twilight cost is +2.
”'This foe is beyond any of you! Run!'”

card.name: All Blades Perish
card.property: Response: If a Nazgul is about to take a wound, prevent that wound.
”'…all blades perish that pierce that dreadful King. More deadly to him was the name of Elbereth.'”

card.name: All Veils Removed
card.property: Skirmish: Make a Nazgul strength +2 (or +5 if the Ring-bearer wears The One Ring).
”'Give up the Halfling…!'”

card.name: Beauty Is Fading
card.property: Maneuver: Exert a Nazgul to discard a Free Peoples possession or Free Peoples condition. If you can spot no such card, discard an ally or companion (except the Ring-bearer) instead.
”'…the Three will fail, and many fair things will fade and be forgotten.'”

card.name: Bent on Discovery
card.property: Search. Plays to your support area. At the beginning of each of your Shadow phases, draw 1 card. At the end of each of your Shadow phases, exert a Nazgul or discard this condition.
“The riding figure sat quite still…. From inside the hood came a noise as of someone sniffing….”

card.name: Black Breath
card.property: Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Transfer this condition from your support area to a character skirmishing a Nazgul. Burdens and wounds may not be removed from bearer.
Vile breath infects the living with Shadow.

card.name: Black Steed
card.property: Bearer must be a Nazgul. While at a plains site, bearer is strength +2. Discard this possession when at an underground site.
”'…these horses are born and bred to the service of the Dark Lord in Mordor.'”

card.name: Blade Tip
card.property: Plays to your support area. Response: If your Nazgul wins a skirmish, transfer this condition from your support area to the losing character. Limit 1 per character. Wound bearer at the start of each fellowship phase. (If bearer is the Ring-bearer, add a burden instead )

card.name: Dark Whispers
card.property: Skirmish: Spot 3 burdens to make a Nazgul strength +1 and damage +1, or spot 6 burdens to make a Nazgul strength +3 and damage +2.
”'The Ring… The Ring… The Ring….'”

card.name: Drawn to Its Power
card.property: Plays to your support area. Each time a companion is killed in a skirmish involving a Nazgul, add a burden.
”'And also the Ring drew them.'”

card.name: Fear
card.property: Search. Maneuver: Exert your Nazgul to discard an ally.
”'Never has such a thing happened in my time! … Guests unable to sleep in their beds, and good bolsters ruined and all! What are we coming to?'”

card.name: Frozen by Fear
card.property: Skirmish: Make a Nazgul strength +2 (or +3 if the Ring-bearer is assigned to a skirmish that has not resolved).
”…he was quaking as if he was bitter cold, but his terror was swallowed up in a sudden temptation to put on the Ring.”

card.name: In the Ringwraith
card.property: Response: If a Nazgul wins a skirmish, the Free Peoples player chooses to either exert the Ring-bearer or add a burden.
”'He is fading…. We must get him to my father.'”

card.name: The Master
card.property: Search. Shadow: Spot X Nazgul to reveal the top X cards of your draw deck. Take into your hand all [Wraith] cards revealed and discard the rest.
”…something seemed to be compelling him to disregard all warnings, and he longed to yield.”

card.name: Morgul Blade
card.property: Bearer must be a Nazgul. This weapon may be borne in addition to 1 other hand weapon. Skirmish: Discard this possession to transfer Blade Tip from your support area or discard pile to a companion bearer is skirmishing.
The gates of Minas Morgul issued Nine Riders into the free lands, a blasphemy to ancient kings.

card.name: Morgul Gates
card.property: Shadow: Play a Nazgul. His twilight cost is -2.

card.name: Nazgul Sword
card.property: Bearer must be a Nazgul. While you can spot 3 burdens, bearer is damage +1.
The weapons of the Nine are wielded by unseen hands willed by Sauron's hate.

card.name: The Nine Servants of Sauron
card.property: Search. Plays to your support area. Each time you play a Nazgul, you may exert a Hobbit (except the Ring-bearer).
”'That Black Rider was looking for something … or someone - Frodo?'”

card.name: Not Easily Destroyed
card.property: Plays to your support area. Maneuver or Skirmish: Remove (3) to heal a Nazgul.
”'They were Kings… great Kings of Men. Sauron gave to them Nine Rings of Power and with them the promise of eternal rule… unending life.'”

card.name: The Pale Blade
card.property: Bearer must be The Witch-king. He is damage +1. Response: If The Witch-king wins a skirmish, exert him to discard a Free Peoples condition.

card.name: Paths Seldom Trodden
card.property: Search. To play, spot a Nazgul. Plays to your support area. Shadow: Remove (3) to replace the fellowship's site with your version of the same site.

card.name: Relentless Charge

card.name: Return to Its Master

card.name: Sword of Minas Morgul
card.property: Bearer must be Ulaire Lemenya. He is damage +1. Skirmish: Exert Ulaire Lemenya to discard a possession borne by a character he is skirmishing.

card.name: Their Power Is in Terror
card.property: Maneuver: Exert a Nazgul to wound every ally.

card.name: Threshold of Shadow
card.property: Skirmish: Make a Nazgul strength +2 (or +4 if you spot 5 burdens).

card.name: The Twilight World
card.property: Response: If Ring-bearer puts on The One Ring, exert a Nazgul to add 2 burdens.

card.name: Ulaire Attea
card.property: Fierce. Skirmish: Remove (1) to make Ulaire Attea strength +1 (limit +5).

card.name: Ulaire Cantea
card.property: Fierce. Skirmish: Exert Ulaire Cantea to discard a weapon borne by a character he is skirmishing.

card.name: Ulaire Enquea
card.property: Fierce. Maneuver: Spot 6 companions (or 5 burdens) and exert Ulaire Enquea to wound a companion (except the Ring-bearer).
The Nine Riders were embodiments of Sauron's will, searching all of Middle-earth for his prize.

card.name: Ulaire Enquea
card.property: Fierce. Maneuver: Spot 6 companions (or 5 burdens) and exert Ulaire Enquea to wound a companion (except the Ring-bearer).
The Nine Riders were embodiments of Sauron's will, searching all of Middle-earth for his prize.

card.name: Ulaire Lemenya
card.property: Each companion or ally who bears a [Wraith] condition is strength -2.
”'Do you wish them to find you? They are terrible!'”

card.name: Ulaire Nelya
card.property: Fierce. Shadow: Exert Ulaire Nelya and spot an opponent's site to replace it with your site of the same number.

card.name: Ulaire Nertea
card.property: When you play Ulaire Nertea, for each companion over 4, you may play 1 minion from your discard pile.

card.name: Ulaire Otsea
card.property: Shadow: Exert Ulaire Otsea to make a [Wraith] minion fierce until the regroup phase.
”…under their mantles were long grey robes; upon their grey hairs were helms of silver; in their haggard hands were swords of steel.”

card.name: Ulaire Toldea
card.property: Fierce. Assignment: Spot 4 burdens to assign a companion (except the Ring-bearer) to skirmish Ulaire Toldea.

card.name: The Witch-king
card.property: Fierce. For each other Nazgul you can spot, The Witch-king is strength +2.
”…his hair was long and gleaming and on his helm was a crown.”

card.name: The Witch-king
card.property: Fierce. For each other Nazgul you can spot, The Witch-king is strength +2.
”…his hair was long and gleaming and on his helm was a crown.”

card.name: Wreathed in Shadow
card.property: To play, spot a Nazgul. Plays to your support area. Archery: Remove (1) to make the fellowship archery total -1.

card.name: All Thought Bent on It
card.property: Search. Maneuver: Spot a [Sauron] Orc and 5 companions to make the Free Peoples player exert a companion for each companion over 4.
”'…for the Ring yearns, above all else, to return to the hand of its Master: they are one….'”

card.name: Band of the Eye
card.property: Response: If this minion wins a skirmish, remove (2) to make the Free Peoples player discard a card at random from hand.

card.name: Curse From Mordor
card.property: Shadow: Spot a [Sauron] Orc to discard an [Elven] condition.

card.name: The Dark Lord
card.property: Search. To play, spot a [Sauron] Orc. Plays to your support area. Shadow: Remove (3) to reveal the top card of your draw deck. If it is a [Sauron] card, take it into hand. Otherwise, discard it and one other card from hand.
Orcs obey the Dark Lord unquestioningly.

card.name: Despair

card.name: Desperate Defense of the Ring
card.property: To play, exert a [Sauron] Orc. Plays on a companion. Each time bearer is assigned to a skirmish, the Free Peoples player chooses to either discard 3 cards from hand or add a burden.

card.name: Desperate Measures
card.property: Maneuver: Spot a [Sauron] Orc and remove a burden to make the Free Peoples player discard top 5 cards from his draw deck.

card.name: Enduring Evil
card.property: Skirmish: Spot X burdens to make a character skirmishing a [Sauron] Orc strength -X.
”'The Dark Tower was broken, but its foundations were not removed; for they were made with the power of the Ring, and while it remains they will endure.'”

card.name: Enheartened Foe
card.property: Response: If a [Sauron] Orc wins a skirmish, make that Orc fierce until the regroup phase.

card.name: Forces of Mordor
card.property: Shadow: Spot X [Sauron] minions to add (X).
”'….the Dark Lord is not without allies. The Easterlings and Haradrim now pay tribute to Mordor.'”

card.name: Gleaming Spires Will Crumble

card.name: Hate
card.property: Maneuver: Exert a [Sauron] Orc to wound a companion (except the Ring-bearer).

card.name: A Host Avails Little

card.name: The Irresistible Shadow
card.property: To play, exert a [Sauron] Orc. Plays to your support area. If you can spot 5 burdens and the Free Peoples player has no cards in his or her draw deck, the Ring-bearer is corrupted.

card.name: Journey Into Danger
card.property: Search. To play, exert a [Sauron] Orc. Plays to your support area. While you can spot 5 companions, each companion's twilight cost is +2.
”'I do not foretell, for all foretelling is now vain: on the one hand lies darkness, on the other only hope.'”

card.name: Mordor Enraged
card.property: Plays on a [Sauron] minion. Shadow: Exert bearer to add (1) for each archer companion.
The armies of Elendil and Gil-galad inflamed Sauron's anger and hatred.

card.name: Mordor
card.property: Skirmish: Exert a [Sauron] Orc to wound a character he is skirmishing.
”'It should have ended that day, but evil was allowed to endure.'”

card.name: Morgul Hunter
card.property: For each companion you can spot, this minion is strength +1.
Sauron's hatred lives in the hearts of his minions.

card.name: Morgul Hunter
card.property: For each companion you can spot, this minion is strength +1.
Sauron's hatred lives in the hearts of his minions.

card.name: Morgul Skirmisher

card.name: Morgul Warden
card.property: For each other [Sauron] Orc you can spot, Morgul Warden is strength +1.

card.name: The Number Must Be Few
card.property: Search. Plays to your support area. While you can spot 7 companions, the move limit for this turn is -1 (to a minimum of 1).

card.name: Orc Ambusher

”'Orcs will often pursue foes for many leagues….'”

card.name: Orc Assassin
card.property: Tracker. The roaming penalty for each [Sauron] minion you play is -1. Assignment: Spot 2 Hobbit companions to make the Free Peoples player assign a Hobbit to skirmish this minion.

card.name: Orc Banner
card.property: Plays to your support area. Each time a companion or ally loses a skirmish that involves a [Sauron] Orc, each [Sauron] Orc is strength +1 until the regroup phase.

card.name: Orc Bowmen

card.name: Orc Chieftain

card.name: Orc Hunters
card.property: Skirmish: Exert this minion to wound a character he is skirmishing.

card.name: Orc Inquisitor

card.name: Orc Scimitar
card.property: Bearer must be a [Sauron] Orc. Skirmish: Remove (1) to make bearer strength +1 (limit +3).

card.name: Orc Scouting Band
card.property: Tracker. The roaming penalty for each [Sauron] minion you play is -1. Skirmish: Exert this minion to wound a character it is skirmishing.

card.name: Orc Soldier
card.property: Skirmish: Exert this minion to wound a character he is skirmishing.

card.name: Orc War Band
card.property: Skirmish: Exert this minion to wound a character it is skirmishing.

card.name: Shadow
card.property: Shadow: Exert a [Sauron] Orc to discard a Free Peoples condition.
”'Is it secret? Is it safe?'”

card.name: Strength Born of Fear
card.property: Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Remove (3) to make a [Sauron] Orc strength +1.
Fear

card.name: Merry

card.name: Noble Intentions
card.property: Skirmish: Exert a companion (except a Hobbit) to make a Hobbit strength +3.

card.name: Sam

card.name: Sam

card.name: Sorry About Everything

card.name: Sting

card.name: Dimrill Dale
card.property: Sanctuary. The twilight cost of the first [Moria] Orc played each Shadow phase is -2.

card.name: Galadriel
card.property: Sanctuary. Fellowship: Exert an Elf to look at an opponent's hand.

card.name: Lothlorien Woods
card.property: Forest. Sanctuary. Each ally whose home is site 6 is strength +3.

card.name: Anduin Confluence
card.property: River. When the fellowship moves to Anduin Confluence, discard every ally.

card.name: Anduin Wilderland
card.property: Forest. River. While the fellowship is at Anduin Wilderland, skip the archery phase.

card.name: Silverlode Banks
card.property: River. When the fellowship moves to Silverlode Banks without a ranger, every companion must exert.

card.name: Anduin Banks
card.property: River. For each companion in the fellowship over 4, add 2 to the minion archery total.

card.name: Brown Lands
card.property: River. For each minion archer at Brown Lands, the minion archery total is +1 (limit +4).

card.name: Pillars of the Kings
card.property: River. Fellowship: Discard a [Gondor] card from hand to heal a [Gondor] companion.

card.name: Shores of Nen Hithoel
card.property: River. Shadow: Spot 5 Orc minions to prevent the fellowship from moving again this turn.

card.name: Emyn Muil
card.property: Maneuver: Exert your minion to make that minion fierce until the regroup phase.

card.name: Slopes of Amon Hen
card.property: The twilight cost of each [Isengard] minion is -1.

card.name: Summit of Amon Hen
card.property: When the fellowship moves to Summit of Amon Hen, each Shadow player may draw a card for each burden.

card.name: Tol Brandir
card.property: River. Shadow: Play up to 3 trackers from your discard pile; end your Shadow phase.

card.name: Gandalf
card.property: Fellowship: Exert Gandalf to play a companion who has the Gandalf signet. The twilight cost of that companion is -2.
”…his long white hair, his sweeping silver beard, and his broad shoulders, made him look like some wise king of ancient legend.”

card.name: Aragorn
card.property: Ranger. At the start of each of your turns, you may heal another companion who has the Aragorn signet.
”'He turned from that path a long time ago. He has chosen exile….'”

card.name: Lurtz
card.property: Archer. Damage +1. Maneuver: Spot another Uruk-hai to make Lurtz fierce until the regroup phase.
